claim.title: Technology that truly matters.
claim.description: For people. With responsibility. Not just a slogan – our benchmark.

vision.title: Vision & Mission
vision.description: Our drive. Our attitude. Our goal.

visionCard.title: Our Vision
visionCard.text: We set the global standard for human-centered, ethical AI systems. For us, technology is not a show – but a quiet force that accompanies, empowers, and protects.
visionCard.quote: "Technology as a quiet force for a good life."

missionCard.title: Our Mission
missionCard.text: We develop systems that sustainably improve people's lives – with dignity, transparency, and responsibility. Our AI strengthens autonomy, protects data, and acts in harmony with European values.
missionCard.quote: Progress with attitude. Not with speed.

identity.title: Our Identity
identity.description: We don't build platforms – we build digital spaces with dignity. Technology as responsibility, not as a game.

guardian.title: The Guardian
guardian.desc: We safeguard what is vulnerable – with clarity, stance, and protection.

architect.title: The Architect
architect.desc: We design robust structures – modular, understandable, and durable.

designer.title: The Designer
designer.desc: Technology is design with meaning. It serves humanity, not as an end in itself.

values.title: Our Values
values.description: They serve as a decision filter, attitude, and orientation – for every product, every line of code, and every encounter.

responsibility.title: Responsibility
responsibility.desc: We take responsibility for the impact of our technologies – on people, society, and the environment.

humanDignityEthics.title: Human Dignity & Ethics
humanDignityEthics.desc: Our AI serves humanity – it does not replace, it protects.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.desc: We act transparently – in code, communication, and decisions.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.desc: We improve the right things – not just make the wrong things more efficient.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.desc: Our systems are maintainable, resource-efficient, and human-friendly.

legalCompliance.title: Legal Compliance
legalCompliance.desc: We embody GDPR and AI regulation – technically and ideally.

ethics.title: Our Ethical Principles
ethics.description: Technology must not dictate – it must empower. Our systems follow principles. No marketing. No coincidence.

autonomy.title: Protect Autonomy
autonomy.desc: Users retain control at all times. No interference. No nudging.
autonomy.explanation: Technology should empower us – not manipulate. Many systems today subtly influence decisions: through design, through algorithms, through ambiguity. We stand against this.
autonomy.example: Social media platforms that use addictive mechanics to increase dwell time – without regard for well-being or autonomy.

responsibility.title: Assume Responsibility
responsibility.explanation: We take responsibility for what our systems do. No 'the AI decided that'. Decisions must be traceable, explainable, and intentional.
responsibility.example: An algorithm rejects a loan application – without anyone being able to explain why. This must not happen.

transparency.title: Live Transparency
transparency.desc: We openly show what is stored – and why.
transparency.explanation: Trust is built not on promises, but on clarity. Users have a right to know what happens with their data.
transparency.example: Many providers collect movement data and share it – without any benefit to the users.

noExploitation.title: No Exploitation
noExploitation.desc: No trackers. No data sales. No profiling.
noExploitation.explanation: Data is not a resource to be exploited. Our systems do not sell – they protect.
noExploitation.example: Tracking advertising that shows you you products months later, even if you never bought them.

longTermThinking.title: Think Long-Term
longTermThinking.desc: Not short-term profit, but sustainable impact.
longTermThinking.explanation: Ethical technology requires a long-term perspective: in maintenance, impact, and impact control.
longTermThinking.example: Startups that want to scale quickly without regard for technical or social consequences.
